item.title: How can I back up my data?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Notepad
OI Safe
OI Shopping List

You can use MyBackup Pro or OI Convert CSV or the build-in backup menus

OI Notepad:
Use OI Convert CSV or MyBackup Pro.

OI Safe:
Use menu > Backup, or menu > Export, or MyBackup Pro.
Notes:
* Use menu > Backup to properly back up your passwords and master key for later recovery in an encrypted format.
* Use menu > Export to export all passwords to a plain readable CSV file.
* Also keep the master password in a safe place.
* See also:
How can I recover encrypted notes or photos after a phone reset?
How can I transfer my passwords to another phone?

OI Shopping List:
Use OI Convert CSV or MyBackup Pro.
* OI Convert CSV with "MS Outlook Tasks" format does not export quantity, price, and tag information.
* OI Convert CSV with "HandyShopper" format exports all fields, but you have to export each list separately.
* MyBackup Pro saves all the information.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: I can not install OI File Manager because it is not correctly signed
item.description:
Application: 
OI File Manager

This error happens on custom builds of Android that have a custom version of OI File Manager pre-installed that uses the same package name, but is not signed with the original OpenIntents certificate.

This issue is known for
* CyanogenMod
* Omfgb ROM
* DeFrost ROM
* GummyJAR ROM
* Liquid Smooth Roms

Please contact the maintainers of those distributions for a solution on how to uninstall the pre-installed file manager.

More information

These ROMs ship a custom version of OI File Manager that has the wrong signature, i.e. that is not signed with the original (i.e. OpenIntents) certificate. Ideally, the maintainers should modify the package name so that their pre-installed file manager and our OI File Manager can be installed concurrently on the same device. Until they provide this update, you should first uninstall the pre-installed file manager so that you can install the latest version of OI File Manager.

If you have root access:
1. Remove the OI File Manager apk file from /system/app
2. Install OI File Manager from Market.

How you can help

Please write to CyanogenMod to take out the old version of OI File Manager from /system/app and only use a version that has been properly signed by OpenIntents:

* Star the following issue report:
http://code.google.com/p/cyanogenmod/issues/detail?id=3805

* Write to this forum:
http://forum.cyanogenmod.com/topic/16205-oi-file-manager-cant-be-updated...
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I transfer my passwords to another phone?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

On old phone:

1. In OI Safe, Menu->Backup which creates /sdcard/oisafe.xml
2. Connect phone to PC via USB and copy oisafe.xml to PC

On new phone:

3. Connect phone to same PC and copy oisafe.xml to new phone.
4. Install OI Safe if not already installed.
5. With OI Safe, Menu->Restore. Or if running OI Safe for the 1st time on new phone there will be a "Restore" button because it detects the oisafe.xml file.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: I had to reset my phone. How can I retrieve my data?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Notepad
OI Safe
OI Shopping List

Unfortunately your data (notes, shopping lists, passwords) are lost, unless you created a back up.

See here how to create a backup before you reset your phone:
How can I back up my data?

The applications OI Notepad, OI Shopping List, and OI Safe store all user data by default in internal memory. These data are lost after a phone reset. It is advisable to regularly back up your data.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: Using GET_CONTENT does not return a file URI anymore
item.description:
Application: 
OI File Manager

The default behavior changed, in accordance with the Android documentation. GET_CONTENT will return a "content:" URI that you can query for the file content. You have to modify your application accordingly.

If you want to obtain a "file:" URI, use the PICK_FILE intent:
/node/164

More information

According to the Android documentation, the previous behavior of OI File Manager as well as other file managers that return the "file:" URI, is wrong:

http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent.html#ACTIO...
"Output: The URI of the item that was picked. This must be a content: URI so that any receiver can access it."

This is also the behavior that Google's GMail application expects when you attach a file. The idea is that you can directly access the returned "content:" URI by opening a stream on that URI.

If you query the content provider on the uri returned, you can:
* use getContentResolver().query(uri, null, null, null, null) to access the columns "Images.Media.DATA" and "Images.Media.MIME_TYPE" to obtain file name and MIME type,
* call getContentResolver().getType(uri) directly to obtain the MIME type,
* use getContentResolver().getFileDescriptor(uri, "r") to access the file content directly.

How to be backward / forward compatible:

Use the following code in onActivityResult():

// obtain the filename
Uri uri = intent.getData();
String filePath = null;
if (uri != null) {
	if (uri.startsWith("file:")) {
		filePath = uri.getPath();
	} else { // uri.startsWith("content:")
		Cursor c = getContentResolver().query(uri, null, null, null, null);
		if (c != null && c.moveToFirst()) {
			int id = c.getColumnIndex(Images.Media.DATA);
			if (id != -1) {
				filePath = c.getString(id);
			}
		}
	}
}
if (filePath != null) {
	// filePath contains path to file.
}
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: The application will not download from Market
item.description:
Application: 
OI File Manager

This is a problem of Android Market.

Please try the following:
From your home screen, press menu > settings > applications > Manage applications > Market > Clear cache.

Then start the download again.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I delete (move, copy, rename) a file?
item.description:
Application: 
OI File Manager

Since 1.3.
Long-tap on a file and use cut and paste option in the context action bar (CAB) following the new Android design guidelines.

Until 1.2

Long-tap on a file. Press and hold the file until the context menu appears. This opens a context menu with the commands "Move", "Copy", "Rename", "Delete", and other possible commands.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I recover encrypted notes or photos after a phone reset?
item.description:
Application: 
Obscura
OI Notepad
OI Safe

Photo or note recovery requires that you have properly backed up your data.
See: How can I back up my data?

If yes, you can do the following to recover your photos:
1) Launch OI Safe. Instead of creating a new master key, click "Restore" when being asked for a new master password. This requires the "oisafe.xml" backup file to be on the SD card.

In case you have created a new master key before restoring the old master key, please note that with the old master key, you will not be able to see the newly encrypted pictures, so it is recommended to decrypt all pictures first, then restore the old master key, and then encrypt all pictures again.

2) Use your old master password to recover your old passwords in OI Safe.
3) Then you should be able to recover your notes in OI Notepad and your photos in Obscura again. (You may have to turn off your phone and on again before they are recognized).

Alternatively you can use MyBackup Pro to recover your OI Safe passwords and your master key. Then you should also be able to recover your photos and notes.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: I forgot my password, how do I retrieve it?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

There is no way to retrieve your master password if you forgot it.

It is advisable to store the master password in a safe place. Also make sure to back up your data regularly (using menu > backup or MyBackup Pro). If you have exported your data previously (using menu > export) and copied oisafe.csv to a safe location, then you can retrieve the passwords from the oisafe.csv file by using menu > import.

You can reset the password by uninstalling and reinstalling OI Safe. Note that this will delete all previously stored items.

You can also clear the data associated with OI Safe and start over. Home -> Settings -> Applications -> Manage Applications -> OI Safe -> Clear Data.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: After I updated the system, I can no longer rename, copy or move files on my SD card
item.description:
Application: 
OI File Manager

Please uninstall and install OI File Manager again.

More information
There is an issue with permission to access SD card when upgrading the system. Users have reported this error after upgrading to Android version 2.1.

The error has been reported on the following devices:
* Droid Eris, Android version 2.1
* Zenithink ZT-180 10,2" , Android 2.1
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How do I enter quantity and price?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Shopping List

In the default theme you can press the name of the item (instead of the check box) to edit it.

If you are using the "Classic" theme, long-press an item and select "Edit item".
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: My password contains letters, but OI Safe only lets me enter numbers.
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

You can hit Menu -> "Switch mode" at the password prompt to switch between normal field entry or the keypad.

In the list of categories, press Menu > More > Change Master Password to change to a password that only contains numbers.

You can also use Menu > More > Settings > Keypad to switch between numeric keypad or normal field entry.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: Import fails. I am getting the error message: "first line incomplete"
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

Solution:

Verify that the first line is identical to the original oisafe.csv file.

"Category","Description","Website","Username","Password","Notes","Last edited"

Why does this error occur?

This error occurs when trying to import a CSV file into OI Safe.

OI Safe is very sensitive to the first line. When you do the Menu->Export it will create /sdcard/oisafe.csv. When you copy that file to your PC, open it up in something like Notepad, pay attention to that first line. Now either use Excel or OpenOffice to edit the .CSV and export back out to a .CSV file. Now use Notepad again to verify that the first line is identical to the original oisafe.csv file. If it's not, then it just won't work.

"Category","Description","Website","Username","Password","Notes","Last edited"

If there are extra spaces or the fields are lower-case, any variation will fail.

See also

* CSV file format for OI Safe is not compatible with Microsoft Excel. Microsoft Excel produces CSV files without quotes. The reply given there links to a VBA example that can export CSV files with quotes: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/291296/en-us
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I delete an item after it has been added to the pick item list?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Shopping List

Long-press the item and select "delete permanently".

You can not do this in the "pick items" list directly. Check the item in the "pick items" list so that it appears in your shopping list. Then long-press the item in your shopping list and select "delete permanently".
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I set a shortcut to a specific list on the home screen?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Shopping List

To set a shortcut to a specific list:
1) Long-press on an empty space on home screen.
2) Select "Shortcuts".
3) Select "OI Shopping List".
4) Select the list you want to link to.

To set a generic shortcut to OI Shopping List:
1) Open the slider with all applications.
2) Press and hold the "OI Shopping List" icon.
3) While holding the icon, move it to an empty space on home screen.
- OR -
1) Long-press on an empty space on home screen.
2) Select "Shortcuts".
3) Select "Applications".
4) Select "OI Shopping List".

Note: The generic shortcut always opens the last list used with the default setting in OI Shopping List. To check the settings:
1) In OI Shopping List, press Menu > Settings > Advanced settings.
2) Make sure "Load last list used" is checked.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: OI Safe can not find oisafe.xml on the SD card
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

Solution

Copy oisafe.xml from /mnt/sdcard-ext/ or /mnt/sdcard2/ to /mnt/sdcard/ so that OI Safe can find the file.

More information

Certain devices have one SD card folder in internal memory and one SD card folder for the actual SD card. OI Safe looks for the backup file at "/mnt/sdcard/oisafe.xml" which is the location of the internal SD card. The path of the external SD card is slightly different: "/mnt/sdcard-ext/oisafe.xml" (notice the "-ext" after "sdcard") or "/mnt/sdcard2/", so in order for OI Safe to find the file, it first has to be copied from the external SD card to the internal SD card. The file can be copied using e.g. OI File Manager.

This applies to the following devices:

  • Motorola Bionic: uses "/mnt/sdcard-ext/"
  • Dell Streak 7: uses "/mnt/sdcard2/"
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: I am getting the error message: "Backup failed: /sdcard/oisafe.xml"
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

Solution:

Please re-install the latest version of OI Safe manually from here:
(without first un-installing)
http://code.google.com/p/openintents/downloads/list?q=oi+safe

Why does this problem occur?

The problem occurs after a system update that introduces new permissions to access the SD card. In the previous system these permissions were not necessary, and therefore not granted. The applications need to be reinstalled in order to be granted permissions to access the SD card.

If I have passwords that haven't been backed up yet, will I lose those when I uninstall and reinstall?

From Market you can only install a newer version, but manually you can install the same version on top of the existing version. This should do the trick, and you should not loose the data under normal circumstances. Just don't uninstall - simply install on top of the existing installation.

In any case, please write the most important passwords on a piece of paper before you proceed, just to be on the safe side.

What is the error message in other languages?

The German error message is:
"Sicherungskopie erstellen fehlgeschlagen: /sdcard/oisafe.xml"
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How can I enter prices for various stores?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Shopping List

Solution

Select menu > settings > advanced settings > track per-store prices.
Then long-press and item and select "Stores..." to add stores and enter aisle and price.
The list will show the cheapest price entered.

More information

The one thing it does do now: if "track per-store prices" is enabled in preferences, you can enter a different price for each store. The cheapest one shows in the item list. In the item stores dialog, the price input is the rightmost one on each row. The other one is for aisle, which currently doesn't do much.

Long-press on a store name to rename or delete a store.

Currently the functionality is limited, but we want to extend this in the future, based also on users' feedback and wishes.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: I upgraded to the latest version and now I get a database error
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

If you get this error after upgrading from an older version of Password Safe (predecessor of OI Safe), install the older version again, export your passwords, deinstall and install the newer version, and import your passwords.

You can find old versions of Android Password Safe here:
http://code.google.com/p/android-passwordsafe/downloads/list?can=2&q=apk

Old versions of OI Safe are here:
http://code.google.com/p/openintents/downloads/list?can=1&q=oi+safe
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: After encrypting and decrypting images, their thumbnails are broken
item.description:
Application: 
Obscura
OI Safe

Delete the /sdcard/DCIM/.thumbnails folder on your SD card, so that all thumbnails are recreated properly.

Description of the problem:
The pictures are intact if viewed in the filmstrip mode but the thumbnails are ruined.
Also, new pictures taken or downloaded are not affected by this problem. It happens after some photos are made private using Obscura, and made public again. Also, removing the SD card and reinserting it does not help.

Solution:
* On your SD card, rename the folder /sdcard/DCIM/.thumbnails into something else (e.g. .thumbnails2) or delete it.
* Then restart Gallery and wait - optionally exit it again and start it again.

All thumbnails should be recreated.

You can use OI File Manager to access your SD card to delete / rename the folder mentioned above. Be careful not to delete by accident your true photos (that is why rename is safer).

The .thumbnail folder is created by Android and it contains all the thumbnails (small images) of your pictures. If everything works, the .thumbnails2 folder can be deleted, as it is no longer required.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: Which shortcuts can I use?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Countdown
OI File Manager
OI Notepad
OI Safe
OI Shopping List

If you connect a hardware keyboard to your device, the following shortcuts are available. They are also accessible by pressing MENU + the letter.

OI NotePad

CTRL + S - Save
CTRL + W - Save As
CTRL + P - Preferences/Settings
CTRL + R - Revert
CTRL + E - Encrypt/Unencrypt
CTRL + I - Import
CTRL + T - Theme

OI Countdown

CTRL + P - Preferences/Settings
CTRL + C - Change Countdown Mode
CTRL + D - Pick Ringtone
CTRL + S - Set Automation

OI File Manager

CTRL + P - Preferences/Settings
CTRL + S - Include/Exclude Media Scan
CTRL + F - New folder
CTRL + M - Multi-select

OI Safe

CTRL + L - Lock Category Index
CTRL + E - Edit Category Index
CTRL + A - Add Category Index

OI Shopping List

CTRL + E - Edit Item
CTRL + M - Mark Item
CTRL + S - Item Stores
CTRL + R - Remove Item
CTRL + C - Copy Item
CTRL + D - Delete Item
CTRL + L - Move Item

CTRL + N - New List
CTRL + C - Clean Up List
CTRL + P - Preferences
CTRL + R - Rename List
CTRL + T - Theme
CTRL + S - Send
CTRL + M - Mark all items
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How do I send a note?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Notepad

Long-click on a note in the list of notes. This opens a context menu with the "Send" command.
item.dc:creator: peli

item.title: How to rename or delete a category?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Safe

Long press on the category and select "rename" or "delete" from the context menu.
item.dc:creator: friedger

item.title: How do I add tags to the notes?
item.description:
Application: 
OI Notepad

Solution:

Long-click on a note in the list of notes. This opens a context menu with the "Edit tags" command.

Can you organize notes in folders?

Once you have added tags to your notes, a selection field will appear at the top of the list of notes so that you can select notes with a specific tag. (You may have to exit OI Notepad with the back button and launch it again for the selection box to appear).
While viewing notes with a specific tag, adding a new note will automatically add this tag to the note.
Select "All notes" to view all notes again.
item.dc:creator: peli
